home.description: This portfolio documents my internship journey as part of the Graduate Programming program at AP Hogeschool. Here, I share my experiences, lessons, and growth during my workplace learning period.
home.techDescription: This is the tech stack I’m able to work with. More will be added soon!
home.projectsDescription: Here are my key projects demonstrating my technical capabilities.
home.experienceDescription: My professional journey in the tech industry so far.
home.skillsDescription: Core competencies I bring to development teams.
home.educationDescription: My formal education in information technology.

experienceDescriptions.beego: I helped clients with basic tech issues at their homes or businesses, such as fixing computers and explaining how to stay safe online.
experienceDescriptions.digipolis: I learned the basics of ICT support by setting up computers and assisting with network setups. It was a great way to see how things work outside of programming.
experienceDescriptions.amotek: I’m worked on a project called AmoTrack, where I’m learning to build a full-stack application using React, PostgreSQL, and Fastify. I’m focusing on both frontend and backend development.

about.title: Full-Stack Developer in Training
about.educationText: I’m currently studying Programming at AP Hogeschool, learning both frontend and backend development. While I enjoy the logic of backend work, I’m also improving my frontend skills to build complete applications from start to finish.
about.languagesText: I’m a native Spanish speaker, fluent in Dutch, and comfortable working in English. This helps me collaborate in diverse teams and understand technical resources in multiple languages.
about.aiPhilosophyText: I see AI as a helpful partner in coding—great for suggesting improvements and catching mistakes, while I maintain full control and understanding of my projects.
about.aiApproachText: I mainly use AI for code suggestions, improving existing solutions, and writing documentation. I’m always careful not to share private code or data with AI tools.
about.aiExample: While building this portfolio, I used AI for layout ideas and troubleshooting, but every decision and line of code is my own.
about.goalsText: I aim to become a fullstack developer focused on maintaining and optimizing existing systems. My priority is improving efficiency and functionality rather than always building new technologies.
about.goalsPhilosophy: It’s not just about creating new features, but about keeping existing systems future-proof and maintainable.
about.methodsText1: I do this by learning new technologies while deepening my existing knowledge—finding a balance between innovation and the practical application of proven solutions.
about.methodsText2: I learn through books like ‘Clean Code’ , 'Head First Design Patterns' and ‘Don’t Make Me Think,’ combined with AI-driven learning methods. I’m always looking for ways to improve code quality and maintainability.

footer.description: Documenting my internship journey at [Company Name] as part of the Programming program at AP Hogeschool.

blog.title: My Internship Journey
blog.description: Follow my adventures and lessons during my internship.

week1.title: Week 1
week1.overview: This week I focused on learning the AmoDrive coding architecture, understanding the project structure, and improving my coding style with help from my seniors.

day.content: This week I started onboarding the project. I received instructions on account management, added projects, and got an explanation of Storybook. I learned a lot about component structure, rewriting components based on senior advice, and project styling logic. I also spoke with my senior about coding rules, used GitHub for updates, received feedback, and discovered new ways of coding. Despite some issues with GitHub and waiting for instructions, I managed to resolve most errors and finalize tickets related to forms, cards, and modals. It was an intensive week, but I learned a lot and am happy with my progress.

week2.title: Week 2
week2.overview: This week I really started with AmoTrack, my new project. We're using React, PostgreSQL, Drizzle, and Fastify. Sounds pretty cool, but it's quite a learning curve!

day.content: The first day was immediately challenging with installing Drizzle and PostgreSQL. Thanks to documentation and old projects from the team, I got everything working. The database connection was successful, and I created my first CRUD endpoint. I received feedback from seniors on my work and tips for thinking more logically and collaborating better. I created new endpoints, optimized server files, and worked on tickets for the user interface and API performance. Working with tickets and PRs took some getting used to, but I learned a lot from the feedback and the process.

week3.title: Week 3
week3.overview: This week things finally went better! I made some progress and my work style has improved.

week4.title: Week 4
week4.overview: This week I was finally able to show a demo to the seniors! I demonstrated how I built the frontend and backend of the AmoTrack project.

week5.title: Week 5
week5.overview: A quiet week, where I mainly focused on pull requests (PRs) and the frontend of AmoTrack. Productive, but also time to relax!

week6.title: Week 6
week6.overview: This week was all about Azure challenges, deployment issues, and a good dose of frontend work. A rollercoaster of technical adventures!

week7.title: Week 7
week7.overview: This week was all about the amo-style-library. My seniors decided to have the components rewritten, but without using MUI.

week8.title: Week 8
week8.overview: This week was quiet, I received feedback from my interim evaluation. Since it was a repeat of last week, I'll just explain it in two days.

week9.title: Week 9
week9.overview: This week I was finally allowed to work on both the frontend and backend again. I'm happy about that!

week10.title: Week 10
week10.overview: An energetic week in which I switched from the Amo-Style-Library to full focus on AmoTrack, both frontend and backend. Made a lot of progress and tackled new challenges!

week11.title: Week 11
week11.overview: Focus on finalizing tickets and timesheet logic, with an eye on the upcoming demo and new challenges.

week12.title: Week 12
week12.overview: A productive week focusing on processing design feedback and preparing for gateway implementation.

week13.title: Week 13
week13.overview: A week full of finalization and refinement, with important steps in timesheets, login, and translations.

week14.title: Week 14
week14.overview: A week of deepening and optimization, with a focus on React Query, role checks, and refining existing features.
